alert.note: Alert for Phillips (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Hastings (North Central Kansas and South Central Nebraska)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued April 29 at 4:55PM CDT until April 29 at 5:30PM CDT by NWS Hastings
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 530 PM CDT FOR NORTHWESTERN PHILLIPS...SOUTHEASTERN FURNAS AND SOUTHWESTERN HARLAN COUNTIES... At 454 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near Stamford, or 21 miles northeast of Norton, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Two inch hail and 60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be injured. Expect hail damage to roofs, siding, windows, and vehicles. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Beaver City, Orleans, Stamford, Long Island and Hollinger. TORNADO...POSSIBLE THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...2.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 900 PM CDT for north central Kansas...and south central Nebraska. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
